name: Inn at Ocean's Edge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were very disappointed when we arrived at the "Inn". Why? It is not an Inn. It is an upscale motel. There are two buildings several hundred feet apart that contain rooms. The dining is another long distance away down in the woods. We were really hoping for a nice relaxing experience in an oceanfront Inn. Unfortunately it was not to be. The place is horrible in the rain. We got soaked trying to get to the dining room as there is no parking anywhere near it. The property and rooms are very nice, but again, it is not an Inn as advertised. Between dining and the room we spent nearly $500.00 per night. It simply wasn't worth it. We ended up not staying as long as we hoped. If you want a nice motel, this is your place. If you want a true Maine Country Inn, there are much nicer choices in the area. Also, the "Inn" is rated a Four Diamond Property. Again, the rooms were nice , but the service was a disaster. Not the Four Diamond level of service we expected.
reviews.title: Nice Motel...Not an Inn

reviews.text: We returned for our second visit to the inn and many fabulous changes had taken place including a magnificent endless edge heated pool and spa. The new dining room is top notch with stunning decor and terrific food. Next year they will open a spa with massage and treatments.
reviews.title: Special...magical spot

reviews.text: Marianne Barrett who runs the Ocean's Edge does so with great charm, as well as efficiency. The magnificent full breakfasts vary every day, but they are always presented beautifully, with homemade baked goods, salmon, fresh juices, fabulous coffee. We were offered quiche, rasberry stuffed french toast made from croissants and belgian waffles on different days.
reviews.title: New England's Finest Inn
Wait until next year...
reviews.text: This is a glorious special place...We really enjoyed the new THE EDGE dining room. unfortunatly the night we were there it was foggy, but the view while dining is unparalleled in the area. The menu is sophisticated and the food was excellent.

My wife and I just returned from a three-night stay at this wonderful inn. Our room was decorated Laura Ashley style with a jaccuzzi and a fireplace. It was large, spacious and had a beautioful view of the water and trees. Mary Ann, trhe innkeeper, was gracious, extremely attentive, and a wonderful cook. She, her husband, and Heather made us feel very much at home. The inn is off the main highway, so it is quiet, unlike many of the establishments on the main road. It has all of the amenities you can think of, including a pool, workout room, and fine dining restaurant. Since we were there in June, it was not crowded, and our every whim was catered to with gusto. This is the finest inn we have ever stayed in, and we can't recommend it too highly. We will return again and again.
reviews.title: What a wonderful place to stay!
Dreaming of the Inn.....
reviews.text: This Review is way overdue but I was looking up camden for Valentines day again this year and Started dreaming of The Inn.

reviews.title: to go or not to go
reviews.text: This Small resort is AMAZING! Just sitting here looking at the pics makes me want to get in my car and take the drive up to take a soak in the jacuzzi, Sleep in the Large king bed, and wake up to an amazing waffle and Fruit Breakfast.

reviews.title: Total Splendor
reviews.text: The innkeepers are warm, friendly, and will greet you everytime you come and go. We stayed for valentines day and they had cookies, cupcakes and Hot coco in the bar for us when we returned from dinner.

reviews.title: a very poor value
reviews.text: The rooms are Very clean and large, each with a king bed, Fireplace and Jacuzzi tub right next to the Bed. (it doesnt get any better)

reviews.title: Don't eat the food!
reviews.text: The Breakfast is homemade, and Delicious! The first morning we had fresh waffles, Fruit, and Muffins, The second we had French toast. Both were made with the freshest ingredients, Cut up fresh fruit, and served on beautiful Plates.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is one lovely place. Beautiful setting, gorgeous grounds and immaculate building.
reviews.title: Loved this place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 2 nights here and I fell in love with the place.
reviews.title: Quality at it's best

likes.liked: — Oversized room with comfortable chairs and very comfortable bed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the main building. Our room was done in all blue and white, everything of fine quality and most important spotless. All rooms have an ocean view.
reviews.title: magnificent

reviews.text: Breakfast was included and all kinds of pasteries, fruits etc. were served plus each morning they had a special full course breakfast and if you preferred something else it was offered if they had the ingredients.
reviews.title: An Inn fit for Bob Nuehart to run
Heaven on Earth at Inn at Ocean's Edge
reviews.text: Personnel were friendly and very helpful.

reviews.title: More like a Hotel than an Inn.
reviews.text: We were looking for the perfect place for a quiet romantic getaway. Our room and the location were nice, but the resort was further from Camden than we imagined. Next time we would choose to stay downtown in a more intimate setting and hope to avoid traveling children.

reviews.title: Very nice, very expensive...but....
reviews.text: Just back...literally - a few hours ago. First let me say, we are a little on the fussy side - especially when paying $280 per night.

reviews.title: Excellent facility and service
reviews.text: We selected the Inn because of TripAdvisor. It certainly was lovely, but our plans to go quiet and read on the lawn by the ocean were nixed - there was construction going on next door - both Saturday and Sunday!

reviews.title: piece of heaven
reviews.text: This is just the type of thing we were trying to get away from! We wish we had known. Stayed in Hilltop - The rooms are large and bright and as another reviewer commented a "tad frou-frou".

Our room was hot even though it was cool out and no heat was on! Caused us to sleep restlessly - we even awakened at 4 and opened both doors to get a cross-breeze. We did see a gorgeous sunrise as a result of our lack of sleep.
reviews.title: Great place
